title: Children placed in emergency accommodation for kids in care are scared, and high-risk children are more likely to get stuck there
content: “Every child I have been with on admission to emergency placements, whether it is foster care or residential, has told me they are scared,” says Claire Brogan, a practice manager with Barnardos.

title: Sixty-six affordable homes in Ballymun are held up amid council reviews
Dublin’s Housing First programme is on pause, raising questions about competitive tendering for social care services
content: “Housing First works best when it is high quality, consistent and for as long as necessary,” says Samara Jones, coordinator of the Housing First Europe Hub.

title: ‘Say what you like about Haughey, he knew how to unblock planning,’ says former Fianna Fáil minister
content: Fianna Fáil MEP Barry Cowen has said the Government needs to follow Charles Haughey’s example to circumvent “planning blockages” and speed up the delivery of housing.

title: ‘Stunned, shocked, disgusted, deflated’: parents of boy beaten by Niall Gilligan react to former hurler’s acquittal
content: On the edge of the vill­age of Sixmilebridge in Co Clare, a couple sit in their kitchen, scrolling through pictures on their phone of their then 12-year-old son. The family dog is at their feet, their younger children playing happily as they look out on rolling green fields.

title: Opinion: The Sacred Heart picture, once ubiquitous in Irish Catholic homes, has a fascinating history
content: Rite & Reason: From the outset, the image had a political edge. During the French Revolution it was adopted as a royalist symbol

title: The scale of this €2.6m Cork property offers something unique
content: Moneygourney offering of homes, guest unit and planning permission for three more will interest a range of buyers, says Catherine Shanahan

title: Watch: CMAT housing song strikes chord with young people
content: In the week when the Government made housing the focus of its revised National Development Plan, CMAT's newest single struck a chord with young people at the sharp end of the housing crisis.

title: DAFT.IE PROPERTY MAGAZINE
content: Tour this Georgian coastal masterpiece in the heart of marvellous Monkstown

title: Plans for 950-bed Cork student accommodation on former Magdalene laundry site put on hold
content: An Coimisiún Pleanála has received four separate appeals against the recent decision of Cork City Council to grant planning permission for the development.

title: UN to try and reach Gaza's starving population after Israeli army announces 'tactical pause'
content: Aid trucks have entered Gaza from Egypt and Jordanian and Emirati planes have dropped 25 tonnes of humanitarian aid over Gaza so far today.
